Jinnō Shōtōki, pp. 147-148. ==Events of the Hōki era== * 23 October 770 (Hōki 1, 1st day of the 10th month): The era name was changed to mark the beginning of Emperor Konin's reign.Brown, p. 277. * 778 (Hōki 9): The emperor granted Kashima-jinja a divine seal for use on documents.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1963) The Vicissitudes of Shinto, p. 206. * 28 August 779 (Hōki 10, 7th month): Fujiwara no Momokawa died at age 48.Nussbaum, "Fujiwara no Momokawa" at p. 206; Titsingh, p. 84. * 781 (Hōki 12, 4th month ): The emperor abdicated in favor of his son, who would later come to be known as Emperor Kammu.
